Issues.Title: Add user defined data to HttpRequest
Issues.Body:
# üöÄ feature request

### Relevant Package
This feature request is for @angular/common


### Description
Currently, there is no way to provide some user-defined data along with a request when creating an HTTP request with `HttpClient`, which will be accessible to `HttpInterceptor`s along with a request.
I was trying to create a loader, which uses `HttpInterceptor` to hide/show. but I want user should we able to specify on which request he does not want the loader to show. This is not possible in the current implementation of `HttpClient`.


### Describe the solution you'd like
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏è--> Currently almost all methods of `HttpClient` accepts options as a parameter, I want options should have an optional property `interceptorsData` of type `{[key: string]: any}`. The same property must also be added to `HttpRequeast`. so, that it became available for `HttpInterceptor`s. The only problem with this solution is that multiple library providers may use the same property names for there library.
If there is some batter solution you have, please comment.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Add user defined data to HttpRequest" (#33561)

Issues.Title: fix(ivy): do not invoke change detection for destroyed views
Issues.Body:
Prior to this commit, calling change detection for destroyed views resulted in errors being thrown in some cases. This commit adds a check to make sure change detection is invoked for non-destroyed views only.

This PR resolves FW-1636.

Issues.Title: fix(ivy): match directives on namespaced elements
Issues.Body:
Prior to this change, namespaced elements such as SVG elements would not
participate correctly in directive matching as their namespace was not
ignored, which was the case with the View Engine compiler. This led to
incorrect behavior at runtime and template type checking.

This commit resolved the issue by ignoring the namespace of elements and
attributes like they were in View Engine.

Fixes #32061
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(ivy): match directives on namespaced elements" (#33555)

view so we can drop the getHostNative utility function (that

Issues.Title: fix(ivy): recompile component when template changes in ngc watch mode
Issues.Body:
When the Angular compiler is operated through the ngc binary in watch
mode, changing a template in an external file would not cause the
component to be recompiled if Ivy is enabled.

There was a problem with how a cached compiler host was present that was
unaware of the changed resources, therefore failing to trigger a
recompilation of a component whenever its template changes. This commit
fixes the issue by ensuring that information about modified resources is
correctly available to the cached compiler host.

Fixes #32869
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(ivy): recompile component when template changes in ngc watch mode" (#33551)

Issues.Title: fix(ivy): avoid implicit any errors in event handlers
Issues.Body:
When template type checking is configured with `strictDomEventTypes` or
`strictOutputEventTypes` disabled, in compilation units that have
`noImplicitAny` enabled but `strictNullChecks` disabled, a template type
checking error could be produced for certain event handlers.

The error is avoided by letting an event handler in the generated TCB
always have an explicit `any` return type.

Fixes #33528
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(ivy): avoid implicit any errors in event handlers" (#33550)

Issues.Title: feat(compiler): record end of expression Token
Issues.Body:
In the past, only the starting index of an expression Token has been
recorded, so a parser could demarkate the span of a token only by the
start locations of two tokens. This may lead to trailing whitespace
being included in the token span:

```html
{{ token1   + token2 }}
   ^^^^^^^^^             recorded span of `token1`
```

It's also not enough for a parser to determine the end of a token by
adding the length of the token value to the token's start location,
because lexed expression values may not exactly reflect the source code.
For example, `"d\\"e"` is lexed as a string token whose value is `d"e`.

Instead, this commit adds a `end` field to expression tokens. `end`
is one past the last index of the token source code. This will enable a
parser to determine the span of a token just by looking at that token.

This is a breaking change because the contructor interface of `Token`
has changed.

Part of #33477.

- [ ] Docs have been added / updated (for bug fixes / features)

- [x] Yes

Issues.Title: fix(ivy): don't infer template context types when in full mode
Issues.Body:
fix(ivy): don't infer template context types when in full mode The Ivy template type-checker is capable of inferring the type of a structural directive (such as NgForOf). Previously, this was done with fullTemplateTypeCheck: true, even if strictTemplates was false. View Engine previously did not do this inference, and so this causes breakages if the type of the template context is not what the user expected. In particular, consider the template: ```html
{{user.index}} out of {{all.length}}
``` As long as `users` is an array, this seems reasonable, because it appears that `all` is an alias for the `users` array. However, this is misleading. In reality, `NgForOf` is rendered with a template context that contains both a `$implicit` value (for the loop variable `user`) as well as a `ngForOf` value, which is the actual value assigned to `all`. The type of `NgForOf`'s template context is `NgForContext`, which declares `ngForOf`'s type to be `NgIterable`, which does not have a `length` property (due to its incorporation of the `Iterable` type). This commit stops the template type-checker from inferring template context types unless strictTemplates is set (and strictInputTypes is not disabled). Fixes #33527.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(ivy): don't infer template context types when in full mode" (#33537)

Issues.Title: fix(core): make QueryList implement Iterable in the type system
Issues.Body:
Originally, QueryList implemented Iterable and provided a Symbol.iterator
on its prototype. This caused issues with tree-shaking, so QueryList was
refactored and the Symbol.iterator added in its constructor instead. As
part of this change, QueryList no longer implemented Iterable directly.

Unfortunately, this meant that QueryList was no longer assignable to
Iterable or, consequently, NgIterable. NgIterable is used for NgFor's input,
so this meant that QueryList was not usable (in a type sense) for NgFor
iteration. View Engine's template type checking would not catch this, but
Ivy's did.

As a fix, this commit adds the declaration (but not the implementation) of
the Symbol.iterator function back to QueryList. This has no runtime effect,
so it doesn't affect tree-shaking of QueryList, but it ensures that
QueryList is assignable to NgIterable and thus usable with NgFor.

Fixes #29842
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(core): make QueryList implement Iterable in the type system" (#33536)

Issues.Title: ci: re-enable material unit tests job
Issues.Body:
The Material units tests job has been disabled with the typescript upgrade
PR since the components repository was still on an old TypeScript version
(due to cyclic dependencies between the framework and components repository).

Since the components repository has been updated to `9.0.0-next.15` and now
uses the compatible TypeScript version, we can re-enable the job.

Related to this change, we need to ignore the `package.json` engines when installing
the dependencies of the components repo. This is because the components repo already
updated to NodeJS v12 and Yarn v1.19.1. This is not the case for the CI setup of
framework. For now, since we don't want to change the dev setup (as it slows down development
if everyone needs to update NodeJS and Yarn), we temporarily disable the engines.

Additionally, the material unit tests job now depends on the actual release packages
(not on the ngtsc compiled ones). This is because the components repo setup relies
on NGCC being run. This is also helpful for validating ngcc against the framework packages.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "ci: re-enable material unit tests job" (#33530)

Issues.Title: Ivy: Library tree-shaking
Issues.Body:
# üêû bug report ### Affected Package The issue is caused by package @angular/cli probably ### Is this a regression? Yes, the previous version works fine ### Description I tried my Angular 8 UI library with Ivy application using Angular 9 RC and even if I only use a single independent module from it, the whole library gets into bundle. In Angular 8 tree shaking worked properly and only the code I used in the app got into bundle after compilation. I was wondering if this is expected behavior during NGCC phase when apps are using Ivy and libraries are still created with view engine? ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction It's pretty hard to give a reproduction for such an issue, especially since my library is proprietary :( It is organized into single component/directive ‚Äî single module and a public-api barrel file, pretty much like CLI would create. ## üåç Your Environment **Angular Version:** 

9.0.0-rc.0
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Ivy: Library tree-shaking" (#33531)

Issues.Title: Error comes while Adding LazyLoading in routes for Custom Library
Issues.Body:
I am creating a angular library, having routes as well module specific structure which are having their own routing, as we creates in App/SRC.
Below is the code description:- 
Library Code:-
ProjectNameModuleRoutingFile:-
const routes: Routes = [ { path: '', redirectTo: 'role', pathMatch: 'full' }, { path:'new', component:CoreUserManagementComponent }, { path: 'role',loadChildren:'./role-management/role.module#RoleModule' } ]
@NgModule({ imports: [RouterModule.forChild(routes)], exports: [RouterModule] })

Applicarion Src :-
AppRoutingFile :-
const routes: Routes = [ { path:'test', loadChildren: () => import('project-name').then((res) => res.ProjectNameModule) } ]
@NgModule({ imports: [RouterModule.forRoot(routes)], exports: [RouterModule] })

Here while creating build of the library, no error comes, also no error comes while running ng serve for the application after adding the library. But while accessing the route from the browser, for which i have added library, it throws error like:- 
"core.js:15723 ERROR Error: Uncaught (in promise): Error: Cannot find module './role-management/role.module'"

Thanks
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Error comes while Adding LazyLoading in routes for Custom Library" (#16052)

Issues.Title: File with only interfaces shows warning "part of the TypeScript compilation but it's unused"
Issues.Body:
This issue impacts 9.0.0-rc.0 and happened while updating https://github.com/SAP/cloud-commerce-spartacus-storefront.

After updating to version 9, serving the project shows a warning:

```
kamik@RED-X1C6 MINGW64 /d/sandbox/cloud-commerce-spartacus-storefront (update-9)
$ yarn start
yarn run v1.17.3
$ ng serve --proxy-config mock-server/proxy.backend.js
10% building 3/3 modules 0 activei ÔΩ¢wdsÔΩ£: Project is running at http://localhost:4200/webpack-dev-server/
i ÔΩ¢wdsÔΩ£: webpack output is served from /
i ÔΩ¢wdsÔΩ£: 404s will fallback to //index.html

chunk {main} main.js, main.js.map (main) 4.99 MB [initial] [rendered]
chunk {polyfills} polyfills.js, polyfills.js.map (polyfills) 222 kB [initial] [rendered]
chunk {runtime} runtime.js, runtime.js.map (runtime) 6.15 kB [entry] [rendered]
chunk {styles} styles.js, styles.js.map (styles) 1.7 MB [initial] [rendered]
chunk {vendor} vendor.js, vendor.js.map (vendor) 4.67 MB [initial] [rendered]
Date: 2019-11-01T18:12:29.381Z - Hash: f2699ec64930156b5cb5 - Time: 31495ms

WARNING in D:/sandbox/cloud-commerce-spartacus-storefront/projects/storefrontlib/src/feature-toggles.ts is part of the TypeScript compilation but it's unused.
Add only entry points to the 'files' or 'include' properties in your tsconfig.
** Angular Live Development Server is listening on localhost:4200, open your browser on http://localhost:4200/ **
i ÔΩ¢wdmÔΩ£: Compiled with warnings.
```

The referenced file is included in the compilation, but is composed entirely of interfaces:
```
export interface FeatureToggles {
  features?: {
    /**
     * Configure feature level.
     * Value corresponds to minor (feature) release version number: '1.0', '1.1', etc.
     * Each subsequent level contains all of the features from previous one.
     */
    level?: string;
    consignmentTracking?: boolean;
    anonymousConsents?: boolean;
  };
}
```
Since interfaces have no runtime representation, this file gets a warning about not being used.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "File with only interfaces shows warning "part of the TypeScript compilation but it's unused"" (#16025)

Issues.Title: Support XDG Base Directory Specfication
Issues.Body:
# üöÄ Feature request

```
- [ ] new
- [ ] build
- [ ] serve
- [ ] test
- [ ] e2e
- [ ] generate
- [ ] add
- [ ] update
- [ ] lint
- [ ] xi18n
- [ ] run
- [ X ] config
- [ ] help
- [ ] version
- [ ] doc
```

### Description
There is a [XDG Base Directory Specification](https://specifications.freedesktop.org/basedir-spec/basedir-spec-latest.html) which supports keeping home directory in linux environments tidy. Currently, `@angular/cli` keeps its global configuration in `$HOME/.angular-config.json` which is poluting user's home directory. According to mentioned above specification, it is advised to keep configuration under `$HOME/.config` directory by default.

### Describe the solution you'd like
Non intrusive solution is provided with #16034 PR. Basically it makes everything working as it is now, until user decides to move current `$HOME/.angular-config.json` to `$XDG_CONFIG_HOME/angular/.angular-config.json`. Then `@angular/cli` will continue using `.angular-config.json` from new location. Where `$XDG_CONFIG_HOME` as per specification: if provided in the environment new location will be `$XDG_CONFIG_HOME/angular/.angular-config.json` other wise `$HOME/.config/angular/.angular-config.json`. This way it does not break other non XDG users like people under Windows.

### Describe alternatives you've considered
No alternatives.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Support XDG Base Directory Specfication" (#16049)

Issues.Title: i18n-locale should inject dir attribute
Issues.Body:
<!--üîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖ

Oh hi there! üòÑ

To expedite issue processing please search open and closed issues before submitting a new one.
Existing issues often contain information about workarounds, resolution, or progress updates.

üîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖ-->


# üöÄ Feature request
Add dir="rtl" for rtl locales

### Command (mark with an `x`)
<!-- Can you pin-point the command or commands that are relevant for this feature request? -->
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏èedit: -->
```
- [ ] new
- [ x ] build
- [ ] serve
- [ ] test
- [ ] e2e
- [ ] generate
- [ ] add
- [ ] update
- [ ] lint
- [ ] xi18n
- [ ] run
- [ ] config
- [ ] help
- [ ] version
- [ ] doc
```

### Description
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏è--> A clear and concise description of the problem or missing capability...
Angular pages are always LTR, even when specifying an rtl language in `i18n-locale` parameter

### Describe the solution you'd like
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏è--> If you have a solution in mind, please describe it.
When running build with `i18n-locale` set to an RTL language such as Hebrew or Arabic, add `dir="rtl"` to html or body tags in index.html.
I know that the cli can modify the html, because `base-href` parameter does it

### Describe alternatives you've considered
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏è--> Have you considered any alternative solutions or workarounds?
Manually setting the dir tag, but then what happens if I want to support different build configs for rtl, and ltr locales? I will have to manually change the dir tag before every build.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "i18n-locale should inject dir attribute" (#16047)

Issues.Title: fix(@angular-devkit/build-angular): temporarily remove localize peer dependency
Issues.Body:

This should be reintroduced in 9.1 or 9.2.  The other remaining "hidden" peer dependencies should be included as well (currently `karma` and `node-sass`) with proper version ranges.

Issues.Title: v9 migration for updating project tsconfig creates invalid file references
Issues.Body:
The tsconfig app update migration for version 9 of the CLI creates invalid references inside tsconfig files. This causes the app compilation to break, and potentially breaks subsequent migrations as the TS project is no longer valid (e.g. the undecorated classes-with-di migration).

The migration currently naively assumes the `main.ts` files is always next to the tsconfig.

https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/blob/e70a2b04bd6bcc545e8f994601acecd75d0c6084/packages/schematics/angular/migrations/update-9/update-app-tsconfigs.ts#L85-L89

This is not very reliable as often the target is structured differently, or the `main.ts` file has a different name. This is totally valid since there is an builder option called `main` that can be set to an arbitrary file.

Ideally the migration would not try to guess the path to the main file, but rather rely on the builder options. An example of a scenario that currently breaks:

```
| packages/my-lib/tsconfig.json
| packages/my-lib/src/main.ts 
```

In those cases, the current migration logic will insert `./main.ts` into the tsconfig, while it should be actually `./src/main.ts`. Same most likely applies to the `polyfills.ts` file. Ideally this would be resolved through the `polyfills` builder option.

cc. @filipesilva
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "v9 migration for updating project tsconfig creates invalid file references" (#16035)

Issues.Title: feat(@angular/cli): Support XDG Base Directory Specfication
Issues.Body:
Explained here: https://specifications.freedesktop.org/basedir-spec/basedir-spec-latest.html

Current change affects reading of global config from `.angular-config.json`. By default it will be created in user's home directory. If user moves it manually to `$HOME/.config/angular/.angular-config.json`, it will be subsequently read from new location.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "feat(@angular/cli): Support XDG Base Directory Specfication" (#16034)

Issues.Title: Failed migration prints confusing message about git HEAD
Issues.Body:
This issue impacts 9.0.0-rc.0 and happened while updating https://github.com/johannesjo/super-productivity.

A failed migration can show the following message:
```
√ó Package install failed, see above.
The update failed. See above.
git HEAD was at 85f08a4d93e684566f751e38e2a2feffe0194cd9 before migrations.
√ó  Migration failed. See above for further details.
```

This message is confusing because it is not clear what to do with the message provided. This message enabled users that are proficient with git to go back to a previous commit. Less proficient users will not be able to interpret the purpose of the message.

Additionally, the message seems to indicate the last commit before the migrations. But this is incorrect, as this commit was that of the immediately previous migration:
```
* 558e5436 (HEAD -> update-9) update steps
* ec5e3201 migrate workspace for @angular/core@9.0.0-beta
* 85f08a4d migrate workspace for @angular/cli@9.0.0-beta.0
* 73e3ee1d Angular CLI update
* a06b9c06 update steps (before migrations)
```

To go back to a point before all the migrations a user would need to revert back to `a06b9c06` instead.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Failed migration prints confusing message about git HEAD" (#16031)

Issues.Title: Updating to version 9 produces many commit messages with the same name
Issues.Body:
This issue impacts 9.0.0-rc.0 and happened while updating https://github.com/SAP/cloud-commerce-spartacus-storefront.

The updating procedure produces (heh) several commit messages with the same name:

```
* 5b3de0f7d (HEAD -> update-9) migrate workspace for @angular/core@9.0.0-beta
* 4cb442ad1 migrate workspace for @angular/core@9.0.0-beta
* fde9f49c1 migrate workspace for @angular/core@9.0.0-beta
* 3691566e6 migrate workspace for @angular/core@9.0.0-beta
* bcde65f2f migrate workspace for @angular/cli@9.0.0-beta.0
* a7a17a1e2 Angular CLI update
```

This makes it hard to distinguish what they are doing.

Related to https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/issues/16013.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Updating to version 9 produces many commit messages with the same name" (#16030)

Issues.Title: `ng add` does not respect version tags on repeat calls
Issues.Body:
This issue impacts 9.0.0-rc.0 and happened while updating https://github.com/SAP/cloud-commerce-spartacus-storefront.

Attempting to use `ng add package-name@version` after a failed `ng add package-name` (such as https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/issues/16028) will not use the selected `version`. It will instead attempt to re-add the already installed package.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "`ng add` does not respect version tags on repeat calls" (#16029)

Issues.Title: `ng add @angular/localize` does not support schematics
Issues.Body:
This issue impacts 9.0.0-rc.0 and happened while updating https://github.com/SAP/cloud-commerce-spartacus-storefront.

After updating to version 9, projects that use i18n or whose third party libraries use i18n will receive a runtime error instructing users to run `ng add @angular/localize`. Running this command shows the following error:

```
kamik@RED-X1C6 MINGW64 /d/sandbox/cloud-commerce-spartacus-storefront (update-9)
$ ng add @angular/localize
Installing packages for tooling via yarn.
... lots of spam, see https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/issues/16027
Installed packages for tooling via yarn.
The package that you are trying to add does not support schematics. You can try using a different version of the package or contact the package author to add ng-add support.
```

This happens because the latest version of `@angular/localize` is  9.0.0-next.5, which doesn't have the `add` schematics (cc @kara). The latest tag should be updated to rc.0.
```
kamik@RED-X1C6 MINGW64 /d/sandbox
$ npm info @angular/localize

@angular/localize@9.0.0-next.5 | MIT | deps: none | versions: 12
Angular - library for localizing messages
https://github.com/angular/angular#readme

dist
.tarball: https://registry.npmjs.org/@angular/localize/-/localize-9.0.0-next.5.tgz
.shasum: 00656e45b10a81196e3654c9a25352860e0f6f24
.integrity: sha512-6aRq3ne2Z9Wh70S3Bmxs1pUxeWS6YPlisrmW2vfPUe5WrOpkgT3kOPgLM/gVFGdq4es58vEAiLcY2PO3W41Sgg==
.unpackedSize: 199.8 kB

maintainers:
- angular <devops+npm@angular.io>

dist-tags:
latest: 9.0.0-next.5
next: 9.0.0-rc.0
```
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "`ng add @angular/localize` does not support schematics" (#16028)

Issues.Title: Virtual scroll within mat-menu don't work correctly
Issues.Body:
#### Reproduction
Try to put cdk-virtual-scroll-viewport within mat-menu.
I implemented the issue on stackblitz and also showed that it works within a plain div but don't work properly within mat-menu: https://stackblitz.com/edit/components-issue-zjhrcj

Steps to reproduce:
1. Open the menu
2. Scroll to about a quarter of the data
3. Close the menu
4. Open the menu again
5. There is no data till you scroll
 FYI: There are also some cases that the data is not filling the whole mat-menu height. I think there is a problem with the calculated translate of cdk-virtual-scroll-content-wrapper.
 
#### Expected Behavior

I expect to see the data after i close & open the menu again and i also expect that the data will fill all height all the time.


#### Actual Behavior

I can't see any data after following the repro. steps and there are times that the data is not filling the whole container height.


#### Environment

- Angular: 8.2.11
- CDK/Material: 8.2.3/8.2.3
- Browser(s): Chrome 78.0.3904.87
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): 18.04.3 LTS
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Virtual scroll within mat-menu don't work correctly" (#17594)

Issues.Title: [Clipboard] Add support for Clipboard Web API
Issues.Body:
#### Feature Description

Currently, the clipboard code from the CDK uses a `<textarea>` element and calls `document.execCommand('copy')` on the selected text in the `<textarea>`. However, this may be troublesome especially if there's a long amount of text to be copied.

What I'm suggesting is to use the [`Clipboard.writeText`](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Clipboard/writeText)  method from the [Clipboard API](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Clipboard_API).

Here's a description of the Clipboard API:

> The **Clipboard API** provides the ability to respond to clipboard commands (cut, copy, and paste) as well as to asynchronously read from and write to the system clipboard. Access to the contents of the clipboard is gated behind the [Permissions API](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Permissions_API); without user permission, reading or altering the clipboard contents is not permitted.
>
> This API is designed to supersede accessing the clipboard using [`document.execCommand()`](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Document/execCommand). _- from [MDN docs for the Clipboard API](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Clipboard_API)_

Currently, the Clipboard API is supported in the following browsers:

![Screenshot of supported browsers table from Clipboard API document on MDN](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/20047125/68081369-f353cf80-fe47-11e9-8d5d-e29bbd04b7a4.jpg)

However, according to the [MDN docs for "Clipboard availability"](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Clipboard#Clipboard_availability), it mentions that:

> The asynchronous clipboard API is a relatively recent addition, and the process of implementing it in browsers is not yet complete. Due to both potential security concerns and technical complexities, the process of integrating this API is happening gradually in most browsers.

#### Use Case

This would add another method of copying text instead of the current approach.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "[Clipboard] Add support for Clipboard Web API" (#17593)

Fixes #17442.

Issues.Title: Why does EventEmitter not working on mat-menu?
Issues.Body:
What is the expected behavior?

The purpose is that I want to reconfirm whether the customer really wants to delete the content.
I have created custom directive `AlertConfirmDirective`. 
_When you click the button (delete), open a dialog to verify that it is no / yes. If Yes, it will emit to event (onConfirmed)_
It's working fine normal component 
but when using it on `mat-menu` with **lazy** list item. it do not working.
I have tired to try with change-detection strategy, setTimeout,... but all not working for me.

#### Reproduction
What are the steps to reproduce?
I have deployed my mini repo to : [Stackblitz](https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-f4ms3d)

```html
<mat-menu #itemActions="matMenu">
  <ng-template matMenuContent let-item="item">
    <button mat-menu-item>{{item.name}}</button>
    <button mat-menu-item 
    alert-confirm 
    name="banking" 
    (onConfirmed)="onDelete(item)">
      Delete
    </button>
  </ng-template>
</mat-menu>
```
Directive called and dialog open but EventEmiter (onConfirmed) not working.
Please review my repo and help me.

Thanks advaced

#### Environment
Angular CLI: 8.3.14
Node: 10.17.0
OS: linux x64
Angular: 8.2.12
@angular/material/ cdk    8.2.3
- Browser(s): Chrome latest stable
- Operating System:  Ubuntu 16.04
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Why does EventEmitter not working on mat-menu?" (#17591)

Issues.Title: Autocomplete: expose option activated event
Issues.Body:
#### Feature Description

At the moment, `mat-autocomplete` only exposes `optionSelected` event which is fired when users choose an option in the autocomplete list. However, if users want to listen to option activated, there is no public API for that.

Option activated means users go through the list of options in autocomplete list by keyboard event. At this point, `mat-option` is marked as active. I've checked `mat-option` APIs but there is no public API for that either.

#### Use Case

I have a use case that I have an autocomplete input field which performs live search for data. This autocomplete field is similar to google search input field. When users go through the list of autocomplete options by arrow down/arrow up, the activated option is displayed on the input field. By listening to option activated event, I can display the activated option in the input field
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Autocomplete: expose option activated event" (#17587)

Issues.Title: fix(overlay): maxWidth and maxHeight not applied when using exact dimensions
Issues.Body:
Usually the `maxWidth` and `maxHeight` are applied to the connected overlay's bounding box, because it's the one that determines the dimensions and the overlay pane stretches to fill them. In the case where an exact position is used, we make the bounding box the size of the viewport and we let the overlay grow on its own, however we weren't re-applying the `maxWidth` and `maxHeight`.

Fixes #17582.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(overlay): maxWidth and maxHeight not applied when using exact dimensions" (#17586)

Issues.Title: Setting `withPush(true)` does not work as expected on cdk overlay
Issues.Body:
#### Reproduction

Use StackBlitz to reproduce your issue: https://stackblitz.com/fork/components-issue

Steps to reproduce:
1. Open [this stackblitz](https://stackblitz.com/edit/overlay-start-bug).
2. Follow the steps in this gif (resize window to less than 222px, and open overlay):
 
 
![overlay height bug](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/9967422/68070135-a2ba7480-fd6a-11e9-8a92-fc2dd572a14a.gif)


#### Expected Behavior

When viewport height is too low, I expect the overlay to be centered in the viewport. To quote the overlay api [`withPush`](https://material.angular.io/cdk/overlay/api):

> Sets whether the overlay can be pushed on-screen if none of the provided positions fit.

#### Actual Behavior

The overlay is positioned with the provided position strategies: 

```
.withPositions([
        {
          panelClass: 'custom-panel1',
          originX: 'center',
          originY: 'center',
          overlayX: 'start',
          overlayY: 'top',
        },
        {
          panelClass: 'custom-panel2',
          originX: 'center',
          originY: 'center',
          overlayX: 'start',
          overlayY: 'bottom',
        },
      ]),
```

But none of them should be used, because they push the content off-screen.

#### Environment

- Angular: 8
- CDK/Material: 8
- Browser(s): Version 78.0.3904.87 (Official Build) (64-bit)
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): macOS
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Setting `withPush(true)` does not work as expected on cdk overlay" (#17585)

Issues.Title: mat-slider thumb briefly disappears on touch release (iOS 13 Safari)
Issues.Body:
#### Reproduction

Steps to reproduce:
1. Using any iOS 13 device, go to  https://material.angular.io/components/slider/overview
2. Drag the slider around. 
 
 
#### Expected Behavior

The slider thumb should stay visible all the time when dragging and releasing it.


#### Actual Behavior

On release of the slider, the thumb briefly disappears. This flickering is very distracting. It happens not all the time, but about 70%. It seems to be also more likely to happen when the slider is dragged towards the end. iOS 12 and previous worked fine.


#### Environment

- Angular: 8.2.2
- CDK/Material: 8.2.2, 7.3.7
- Browser(s): iOS 13 Mobile Safari
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): iOS 13
![mat-slider-ios13-flicker](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/11821291/68059027-671f9c00-fcd1-11e9-9c38-023ffde5bc82.gif)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "mat-slider thumb briefly disappears on touch release (iOS 13 Safari)" (#17581)

Issues.Title: Remove example code from JSDoc
Issues.Body:
#### Documentation Feedback

API docs with usage example code don't get formatted. We should avoid putting code snippets in these API docs.

Our Overview (sourced from `.md` file) and Examples is where example code should live.

**Affected documentation page:**
- [CdkNestedTreeNode](https://material.angular.io/cdk/tree/api#CdkNestedTreeNode)
- [New clipboard docs](https://next.material.angular.io/cdk/clipboard/api)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Remove example code from JSDoc" (#17579)

Issues.Title: Chips: Opacity is not added to the ripple element when using CSS variables to define a custom theme
Issues.Body:
In the bug demo below, I use CSS variables to define a custom theme (so I can change it dynamically). Please see the '_styles.scss_' file.

**Demo:** https://stackblitz.com/github/JoakimZebic/angular-material-chips-bug-report

**Steps to reproduce:**
1. Click on any 'colored' chips

**Expected Behavior**
Ripple effect should have opacity.

**Actual Behavior**
Ripple is a solid color (depending on the contrast color of the theme) and doesn't have opacity.


**Environment**

- Angular: 7.2.0
- CDK/Material: 7.3.7
- Browser(s): Chrome, Firefox
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): Windows 10
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Chips: Opacity is not added to the ripple element when using CSS variables to define a custom theme" (#17577)

Issues.Title: fix(material/chips): fix ripple element opacity when using CSS variable theming
Issues.Body:
Fixes a bug in the Angular Material `chips` component where ripple element doesn't have opacity when CSS variables are used to make a dynamic theme

Fixes #17577
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(material/chips): fix ripple element opacity when using CSS variable theming" (#17576)

Issues.Title: fix(material-experimental/mdc-button): rename state class
Issues.Body:
Renaming our state container from `mat-mdc-button-state` to `mdc-button__ripple` to get closer to matching MDC (also less overrides necessary for internal GM implementation)

Also, fixed issue where the stoked state layer was missing a pixel of coverage at the corners

Issues.Title: mat-action-list missing disabled styles
Issues.Body:
See https://github.com/angular/components/issues/763#issuecomment-548873994

Disabling the items in `mat-action-list` does not apply a disabled style. This can be seen in our dev-app.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "mat-action-list missing disabled styles" (#17574)

Issues.Title: build: decorator validation rule skipping property check if next line is disabled
Issues.Body: Fixes the decorator validation rule skipping all of the property presence checks if there's a `disable-next-line` inside the object literal. The problem comes from the fact that if the check fails, we report a failure on the entire decorator node. These changes switch to reporting the failure only on the name.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "build: decorator validation rule skipping property check if next line is disabled" (#17569)

Issues.Title: build: max-line-length check not catching all cases
Issues.Body:
In tslint 5.19.0 they added a separate option that determines whether strings should be checked and it seems to have been defaulted to `false` (https://github.com/palantir/tslint/pull/4798). As a result we ended up with a few places where the limit was being violated.

These changes explicitly enable checking of strings and fix the failures that we had accumulated.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "build: max-line-length check not catching all cases" (#17570)

Issues.Title: Document naming convention for material files
Issues.Body:
I have tried searching through the issues here and on slack. I couldn't find details on this in the CODING_STANDARDS.md document.

The angular.io styleguide states:

> ‚ÄúDo follow a pattern that describes the symbol‚Äôs feature then its type. The recommended pattern is feature.type.ts.‚Äù

What is the reasoning behind leaving off the 'type' in the component file name for material components?
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Document naming convention for material files" (#17571)

Issues.Title: Setting maxHeight on overlay with flexibleConnectedTo strategy does not work, when viewport margin is also configured
Issues.Body:
#### Reproduction

Steps to reproduce:
1. Visit the [stackblitz](https://stackblitz.com/edit/understanding-overlay-03-viewport-margin-bug)
2. Click the 2 buttons
 
 
#### Expected Behavior

That the max height of 300px is respected in both cases


#### Actual Behavior

Max height is only respected, if `withViewportMargin(10)` is not configured. 


#### Environment

- Angular: 8.2.13
- CDK/Material: 8.2.3
- Browser(s): `Version 78.0.3904.70 (Official Build) (64-bit)`
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): `macOS Mojave`

#### Gif

![bug-2](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/9967422/68024963-e1d5c080-fcab-11e9-8f39-c4a25de26309.gif)

#### Relevant code

```typescript
const overlayRef = this.overlay.create({
      hasBackdrop: true,
      positionStrategy: this.overlay.position().flexibleConnectedTo(element)

      // The max height is only respected, if the viewport margin is left out
      .withViewportMargin(10) // <------

      .withPositions([
        {
          originX: 'end',
          originY: 'bottom',
          overlayX: 'end',
          overlayY: 'top',
        },
      ]),
      width: '200px',
      maxHeight: '300px',
    });
```
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Setting maxHeight on overlay with flexibleConnectedTo strategy does not work, when viewport margin is also configured" (#17567)
